posts.title: Claudelle Inglish
posts.excerpt: SynopsisClaudelle Inglish, the teenage daughter of a Georgia sharecropper, is in love with Linn Varner, a farmboy. Claudelle’s mother, Jessie, all too aware of her own drab existence, tries to discourage the romance by urging Claudelle to marry S. T. Crawford, an older, wealthy farmowner. But Claudelle refuses, and she remains faithful to Linn even …

posts._title: Jean Negulesco – The Gift of Love (1958)
posts.title: The Gift of Love
posts.excerpt: The Gift of Love is a remake of 1946’s Sentimental Journey, with Lauren Bacall in the role originated by Maureen O’Hara. Upon learning that she hasn’t long to live, Bacall, the devoted wife of Robert Stack, adopts young Evelyn Rudie so that her husband will never be lonely. After his wife’s death, however, the pragmatic …

posts._title: Pierre Pinaud – Les Miettes AKA Crumbs (2007)
posts.title: Les Miettes
posts.excerpt: A factory worker lives in a small house and does her shopping at the local store. One morning as she’s getting ready for work, she learns that the factory, which is the center of her universe, is about to move and disappear from sight.

posts._title: Andrey A. Tarkovskiy – Andrey Tarkovsky. A Cinema Prayer (2019)
posts.title: Andrey Tarkovsky A Cinema Prayer
posts.excerpt: The documentary recounts Tarkovsky’s life and work, letting the director tell the story himself, as he shares with us his memories, his view of art and his reflections on the destiny of the artist and the meaning of human existence.

posts._title: Xiaoshuai Wang – Dijiutianchang AKA So Long, My Son (2019)
posts.title: Dijiutianchang
posts.excerpt: ‘We’re waiting to grow old’. This sentence briefly sums up Yaoyun and his wife Liyun’s bitter realisation about their lives. They were once a happy family – until their son drowned playing by a reservoir. And so Yaojun and Liyun leave their home and plunge into the big city, although nobody knows them there and …

posts._title: Yoshiaki Kawajiri – Jûbei ninpûchô AKA Ninja Scroll (1993)
posts.title: Jûbei ninpûchô
posts.excerpt: Quote:A vagabond swordsman is aided by a beautiful ninja girl and a crafty spy in confronting a demonic clan of killers – with a ghost from his past as their leader – who are bent on overthrowing the Tokugawa Shogunate.

posts._title: Leonid Gaidai – Kavkazskaya plennitsa AKA Kidnapping, Caucasian Style (1966)
posts.title: Kavkazskaya plennitsa
posts.excerpt: Leonid Gaidai’s irreverent comedy updates a Leo Tolstoy story for modern Soviet times, in the Caucasus region. Shurik, a naive Russian student mired in his own clumsy Soviet culture, sets off to the Caucasus to write down the folk culture of this region: its traditions, legends, sayings, and toasts.

posts._title: Michael Pfleghar – Die Tote von Beverly Hills AKA Dead Woman from Beverly Hills (1964)
posts.title: Die Tote von Beverly Hills
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:‘[An accidental detective] begins to investigate the death of an attractive woman whose naked body was found in Beverly Hills. When he recovers her journal, he is taken into her past where he finds that she lead a sexually promiscuous life. Perhaps in the pages of the diary will be a clue to her killer’s …

posts._title: Richard Quine – Drive a Crooked Road (1954)
posts.title: Drive a Crooked Road
posts.excerpt: Music Box Theatre writes:Before becoming famous for creating PETER GUNN and the PINK PANTHER movies, Blake Edwards scripted this extraordinary, if virtually unknown, ’50s film noir, which casts a fully-grown Mickey Rooney against type as a lovelorn mechanic whose craving for fast cars and a faster woman (the alluring Dianne Foster) drives him to sign …

posts.title: Le fils
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Ange leaves New York to fly to his native Corsica. His mother is dying and Ange, who was not present when his father died, wishes to be present at her death. In Corsica Ange finds his brother Baptiste who married Maria, the woman he loved. He finds out that his father was killed, but nobody …
